name: mira
text: This strip made me nostalgic for my first website.

name: hollis
text: Oh jesus, me too.  Using only the primary colors, I created something physically painful to look at.

name: tellumo
text:
I'm not sure if I was that advanced, but I made some terrible ones. It took me a long time to figure out that just because I could put something after should .

But hey, at least I never used or .

name: johnnyrocker
text:
I used

I admit it. I am not ashamed.

name: lux
text: Are you sure?

name: twistedpriest
text: I used the <MARQUEE> to make cockboats float gently across the screen. Oh, the good old days.

name: syrinx
text: Can I get a shoutout to mah boyz Geocities and Angelfire?

name: tellumo
text: Word! And we definitely got Tripod up ins . . .

name: stuart
text: A comment left by stuart was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by MrMojoRisin, Pox, madnes, mashisoyo, SSDDR, radarjammer, Meetzorp, woodenteeth, verplanck, davidbs, ravindra108, hellofditties, Tibia, Madoushi)

name: stuart
text: A comment left by stuart was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dismas, mashisoyo, Private_Public)

name: ravindra108
text: Assuredly, MySpace is a travesty, a crime against god and nature. But, his was a shoutout to the old school, of which MySpace is not.

name: stuart
text: Myspace is to bad web design what The Stray Cats are to rockabilly music.

name: mr_lostman28
text: They do it so well, people enjoy it again?

name: shutup_shutup
text: Arguing with yourself?

name: crinklebat
text: Man, this harkens back to lunch money days. I switched to Angelfire after a boy who liked me "hacked" my Geocities website. Oh, 7th grade.

name: relaxing
text: what was your geocities password?  you can disclose it now, it's safe for us.

name: autrepoupee
text: does anybody else remember Homestead?  It was insanely easy, I think you could just drag-and-drop GIFs of screaming skulls to your heart's content.  My site was about Space Ghost, Petz, and Creatures,  with a strong focus on breeding Norns to have fun colored fur.

name: johnnyrocker
text: Yeah dude Homestead was the shit .

name: sje46
text:
Oh! Oh, duuuuude.
I have to find my old site.

name: sje46
text: meh.  cant

name: hotmethodist
text: yeah it definitely took me a hell of long time to pick which "neighborhood" I wanted my GeoCities website in back in the day.

name: shoinan
text: Wow that took me back. Weird to be all nostalgic about the Internets.

name: hungoverdrawn
text: Awesome

name: umbra
text:
I died when I first read this strip.

"I AM in hell, when I look at your website."

hell of flashing gifs on geocities and angelfire pages.

name: em2
text: This stuff is still out there.

name: origotoshi
text: No it's not.

name: deimosrising
text:
Lyyyyyyyyyle

God he is so awesome

name: bron
text: Lyle isn't one to "try" things.

name: history
text: When you can look at something and know immediately that it is completely wrong, why try it?

name: ambala
text: I start out feeling bad for Teodor b/c Lyle is harrassing him, but the last panel shows that his website warrants nothing but criticism.

name: mortshire
text: i have been to that website and back many a time.  it is of a foul breed.

name: jokercross
text: And still, in this day and age, there are people who insist on creating content that is impossible to view on any level.

name: stella
text: ..and then they started myspace

name: nathanielperson
text: The more things change.

name: m3funkyb
text: lyle is such a dick

name: phthoggos
text: Dancing baby: already old in 2001.

name: 1000hz
text:
I made my first website in 1999.

It was about Pokemon.

name: gormster
text:
My first website contained only the lyrics to Eminem's 'The Real Slim Shady'.

Now I do it for a living. Coincidence?

name: neitherman
text: Do what?  Transcribe song lyrics from CD liners to webpages?  Write rap music?  Took over as Slim Shady?

name: mystkmanat
text: I am genuinely curious about the answers to these questions.

name: redjoker
text: i second that e-motion... see what i did there?

name: landowmpg
text: His activities are so poorly conveyed.

name: bixschmix
text: Mine was about Wallace and Gromit. For a sixth grader, I at least had taste. I stand by my love for Wallace and Gromit. (Not so much by my usage of animated GIFs of said Wallace and Gromit.)

name: 1000hz
text: Oh yes how I used the Animated GIF.

name: tekende
text: Wallace and Gromit are so frigging great. Chubby for your taste in British cartoons.

name: lux
text: I made my first HTML website in 5th grade and linked GIF images of Pokemon cards. All of my backgrounds were solid colors. Gimp websites ftl.

name: sparhawk
text: Mine included Digimon as well. Plans included a mysterious webmaster amed Wargreymon. It was me. I was Wargreymon.

name: tekende
text: Dude, spoiler warning

name: kharitonov
text:
Mine I had a Homestead or something, back when it was free, and I couldn't figure out how to use pictures aside from the default clip art of a palm tree. So I just renamed it Digimon Oasis.

I think mostly it was about how that blond kid shouldn't date that one chick.

name: zapatos
text: I love pokemon so much, I am twenty three years old.

name: tekende
text: How old would you be if you did not love Pokemon?

name: zapatos
text:
You can hate pokemon at any age I suppose. I was just clarifying that I love pokemon, and am over the age of seven.

I would be eleven when I did not love Pokemon, because I had yet to learn of it. I remember seeing a box with a large plant monster and strange diagrams in my Nintendo Power, so many years ago.

name: mashisoyo
text: Woah, me too! Although it was 1998, I believe. Have tried and failed to track it down.

name: spectre
text: I fuckin' HATE artsy-fancy web designers who design for each other and THE HELL if any of us can actually USE their sites.

name: evolume
text: The font is probably also "Papyrus."

name: relaxing
text: Or the broken typewriter font.

name: envika
text: or comic sans...

name: trollcollins
text: If Comic Sans is the disease within our community, Papyrus is the congenital defect.

name: greymantledwolf
text: the burden of webdesign...

name: buttermoths
text: Hella poignant.

name: werthog42
text: I am thankful for this strip, as it demonstrates the perfect comeback for "Go to Hell." Nay, the only comeback.

name: jpenpage
text:
"I AM in hell, when I look at your website!"

That was when I knew I was sticking with Achewood 'til the end.

name: cousinted
text: Hell is other people's websites.

name: heccibiggs
text: Did anyone else ever use Expages? Where you had to create a whole other account if you wanted your "website" to have more than one page?

name: varnish
text: Oh god expage. Oh god, no.

name: snowman
text: I love it when Lyle is just SUPER unreasonable.

name: redmange
text: I am so ashamed of myself that my eyes have vanished.

name: hamscout
text: Why is Theodor programming the website of a bible-belt housewife's craft store?

name: alexlike
text: Teodor's angry frustration in panel four is terrific

name: direhaggis
text: I fondly remember ear-shattering MIDI music pouring out of my machine on many an Angelfire page. Oh, and rotating icons that went really slow or changed the Earth's sidereal rotation with their speed.

name: brokeaccount
text:
[IMGS OFF]

I miss hosting a Placebo fan page featuring my own angsty poetry, I really do. And is it just me, or does the dancing baby make anyone else throw up in their mouth a little because it reminds them of Calista Flockhart?

name: meetzorp
text: I only knew of it because of Calista Flockheart, and I HATED Ally McBeal. I wanted to climb into the TV and beat the whine out of her. Hell, I'm getting irritated just remembering that show even existed!

name: lux
text: Oh hell, how can we amateur linkers compare with Brian Molko's hedonism, though?

name: sparhawk
text:
When she dances with that spectral milk child it is a thing.

Later it tries to actively skewer her with a spear.

name: cracklewater
text: It reminds me of the sacred right to choose.

name: tekende
text: I dunno, man, back in the day I kind of wanted to, how you say, have lots of sex with Calista Flockhart.

name: brokeaccount
text: Nah man, she's too bony. Her hips would pierce something vital and then you'd lie there on top of her bleeding to death but she'd be too weak to get out from under you what with all the never eating a single thing in her entire life so she wouldn't be able to call an ambulance and you would die. But then she'd die as well so maybe it's a worthy sacrifice.

name: tekende
text: Oh sweet, the baby is totally dancing in time to the song I am listening to (King Crimson - Larks' Tongues in Aspic, Part III, the version on Absent Lovers ).

name: awksedperl
text: Chubbied for good taste.

name: cyberia
text: Lyle's witty repartee makes me giggle.

name: doubleclef
text: I AM in hell!

name: awko
text: "Dancing Baby" is a routine I have a tendency to perform after consuming massive quantities of booze or booze-like substances.

name: sparhawk
text:
Lyle is a lot more adroit with his putdowns in these heady early days.

As it stands he now needs to add an 'ese' and The Bird to every finisher. Insecure.

name: gekimo
text: i think its impossible for ones first website not to look ridiculous

name: lolsworth
text: The Dancing Baby: the birth of the Internet Meme.
